availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Harvey Miller (Ohio County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier in the 6th Ky C.S.A.)

body.p: Ohio County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Martha Thomas Miller in Ohio County, Kentucky, on August 16, 1849. Father of Lycurgus Miller, Inez Miller, Annetta Miller, and Cora Miller. Blacksmith in Ohio County in 1850. Merchant in Ohio County in 1860. Served in Co. B, 6th Kentucky Infantry (C.S.A.) as a private from September 26, 1861 to October 28, 1861, elected second lieutenant on October 28, 1861, promoted to first lieutenant and resigned May 10, 1862. Tavern keeper in Ohio County in 1863.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Hartford, p. 784.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Ohio County Marriages, Film #001913021, p. 88.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 294-5.
"Wiliam H. Miller (1827-1871)," Find A Grave, Memorial #35592379, accessed September 30, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/35592379.
